text: Charles Fletcher Janerette, Jr. (December 1, 1938 - October 26, 1984) was an American football defensive tackle. He played college football at Penn State and spent six seasons playing professional football with the Los Angeles Rams, New York Giants, New York Jets, and Denver Broncos. Janerette was killed in 1984 after being shot by a police officer. ==References== Category:1938 births Category:1984 deaths Category:Penn State Nittany Lions football players Category:Los Angeles Rams players Category:New York Giants players Category:New York Jets players Category:Denver Broncos players
title: Charlie Janerette
